channel.title: Comments on: Building a need for algebraic reasoning – how can computers help?

item.description: […] I argued in a previous post, this is why most people say they haven’t needed the math they learned in school in the real […]

item.title: By: Robert Gordon (@RPGordon87)
item.dc:creator: Robert Gordon (@RPGordon87)
item.description: I think your philosophies play into the natural abilities humans have as pattern inclined, puzzle solvers. Thanks for your post.
item.content:encoded: I think your philosophies play into the natural abilities humans have as pattern inclined, puzzle solvers. Thanks for your post.

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/03/12/building-a-need-for-algebraic-reasoning-how-can-computers-help/#comment-181">David Wees</a>.
Thank you David - it would be great to hear what your teachers think. Keep me posted.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to David Wees.

Thank you David – it would be great to hear what your teachers think. Keep me posted.

item.title: By: David Wees
item.dc:creator: David Wees
item.description: I think you could easily extend this table of values argument to a lot of areas of mathematics rather than just algebra. I'm going to see what our 8th and 9th grade teachers (who teach this level of algebra) think of this idea.
item.content:encoded: I think you could easily extend this table of values argument to a lot of areas of mathematics rather than just algebra. I’m going to see what our 8th and 9th grade teachers (who teach this level of algebra) think of this idea.
